required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preoperative and Postoperative ctDNA Comparison in Early Stage Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Preoperative and Postoperative ctDNA Comparison in Early Stage Lung Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

brief_summary.textblock: Mutation-positive peripheral blood ctDNA became mutation-negative after surgical removal of the cancer tissue. All subjects in the control group were negative for ctDNA mutations。

primary_outcome.measure: The potential value of ctDNA in the diagnosis of NSCLC
primary_outcome.description: The sensitivity,specificity,positive predictive valueand the negative predictive value of mutations in plasma ctDNA for detecting early-stage lung cancer

clinical_study.condition: Preoperative and Postoperative ctDNA Comparison in Early Stage Lung Cnacer

study_pop.textblock: The target population comprises all adult patients aged 18 years and older who present with pulmonary nodules.The study sample will include 60 subjects.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:Patients with pulmonary nodules who underwent curative-intent resection were able to enter the study -
Exclusion Criteria:Patients who received any invasive examination or treatment prior to resection or had a history of malignancy; patients who do not attend follow up after surgery; blood samples that were contaminated; and biopsies that exhibited advanced lung cancer in pathology。
-

overall_official.affiliation: Second Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University
